bibl.title: Military Orders for Walter Reed, September 26, 1899

div1.p: Reed is directed to proceed from Washington, D.C. to Fort Thomas, Kentucky. [Courtesy of the National Archives and Records Administration]

div1.head: Military Orders for Walter Reed, September 26, 1899
div1.p:
OFFICE OF ADJUTANT GENERAL
Sept 26
1899
281760
WAR DEPARTMENT

Filed with 2959 AGO 80
Directing Maj. Walter
Reed, Surg. U.S.A.
to proceed to Fort
Thomas, Ky. confer-
ring with the Surg.
Genl. before starting.

Received A.G.O.
M. & R. D SEP 26 1899

Approved,
By order of the
Secretary of War.

Maj. Walter Reed
Sur -USA- to Ft Thomas
Ky- & direct him to
Confer with Surg Genl before
Starting.
[unclear]
u.s.a

U.S.A.
Sept 26/99
Mr Koher
Make order
CHC

div1.head: Letter from W. O. Carter to Walter Reed, September 26,1899
div1.opener:
WAR DEPARTMENT,
ADJUTANT GENERAL's OFFICE,
WASHINGTON.
September 26, 1899.
Major Walter Reed,
Surgeon, U. S. Army,
Through Surgeon General, U. S. Army,
Washington, D. C.
Sir:
div1.p:
The Secretary of War directs, as necessary for the public
service, that you proceed from this city to Fort Thomas, Kentucky,
on official business pertaining to the Medical Department of the
Army, under such instructions as may be communicated to you by
the Surgeon General of the Army, and that, on completion of this
duty, you return to your proper station.
div1.closer:
Very respectfully, W. O. Carter Assistant Adjutant General.
MAILED SEP 26 1899
